revised_title: Experimental Investigation of Elastic and Inelastic Cross-Sections of the Mercury Atom
tldr: The authors developed an apparatus to measure the elastic and inelastic cross-sections of a mercury atom when colliding with electrons. They found the total, elastic, and inelastic cross-sections for electrons with energies ranging from 4 volts to 180 volts. Additionally, they obtained ionization and excitation functions for specific energy losses in mercury, providing valuable insights into atomic and molecular physics.
